elements.title: Maryina Roshcha
elements.contents: ... that the upcoming Moscow Metro station Maryina Roshcha's four escalators (pictured) are the longest in Moscow?

elements.title: James Freeman
elements.contents: ... that in 1785, at the age of 24, James Freeman convinced his congregation to adopt his revised prayer book, which contributed to King's Chapel becoming the first Unitarian congregation in the United States?

elements.title: Haunted House
elements.contents: ... that Haunted House has been called one of the earliest video games in the survival horror genre?

elements.title: Bernie Wrightson
elements.contents: ... that Bernie Wrightson spent seven years drawing an illustrated edition of Mary Shelley's 1818 novel Frankenstein?

elements.title: Highfield Cocoa and Coffee House
elements.contents: ... that the Highfield Cocoa and Coffee House in Sheffield, England, sold tea, coffee and cocoa at a penny a pint and also provided billiards and reading rooms?

elements.title: 1857 baseball convention
elements.contents: ... that under a rules draft presented at the 1857 baseball convention, baseball bats would have been allowed to be shaved flat on one side?

elements.title: Norcliffe Norcliffe
elements.contents: ... that Norcliffe Norcliffe was severely wounded in the head at the Battle of Salamanca but survived?

elements.title: Texas two-step
elements.contents: ... that a solvent company can access the bankruptcy courts by doing the Texas two-step?
